page.title: 18TOURISM, CARAVAN SITE
page.content: THE MANAGERESS OF THE NORMANS BAY CARAVAN SITE HAS BEEN THERE 6 YEARS. THEY HAVE 175 CARAVANS ON THE SITE. IT HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED 20 YEARS. SOME VILLAGERS HAVE COMPLAINED ABOUT THE CAMP. THERE IS SOMETIMES A BIT OF VANDALISM. THE SEASON STARTS ON MARCH 1, AND FINISHES OCTOBER 31. DOGS MUST BE KEPT UNDER CONTROL, AND NO BALL GAMES ARE ALLOWED ON THE SITE. THE MANAGER AND MANAGERESS DO NOT HAVE A HOLIDAY DURING THE SEASON. MR COSSER OWNS 50 ACRES OF LAND WHERE HE KEEPS SHEEP AND CATTLE. IN WINTER HE TAKES THEM TO HIS CROWHURST FARM, LOWER WILTEN FARM. HE HAS 120 ANIMALS ALTOGETHER SPREAD BETWEEN BOTH FARMS. ONE OF THE BIGGEST CHANGES HE HAS NOTICED IS THAT THE ANIMALS DO NOT LIVE SO LONG NOW BECAUSE PEOPLE LIKE TO BUY LEANER MEAT, SO THEY ARE KILLED EARLIER.
